article.headline: American U. 60, Manhattan 48
article.story: NEW YORK -- Garrison Carr scored 21 points, Brian Gilmore had 17 and American never trailed in a 60-48 victory over Manhattan on Monday night. Derrick Mercer added eight points and Jordan Nichols had six points and 10 rebounds for the visiting Eagles (6-6). Jamel Ferguson scored 11 points and Chris Smith had eight for the Jaspers (7-4), whose three-game winning streak ended. American shot 45.7 percent from the floor and held Manhattan to just 30.5 percent shooting. The Eagles were 8-of-17 from 3-point range to just 5-of-20 for the Jaspers. Carr and Gilmore each scored nine points in helping American to a 32-20 lead at halftime. Carr's 3-pointer extended it to 44-30 with 14:13 left in the game. Brandon Adams converted a three-point play to cut the margin to 47-41 with 10:07 to go, but the Jaspers came no closer.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
